3930/A0/04/802/001.headline: Strong political commitment and momentum as major capacity-building rolled out.

3930/A0/04/802/001.indicator_name: ECD policy and implementation plan in place
3930/A0/04/802/001.headline: Strong political commitment and momentum as major capacity-building rolled out.

3930/A0/04/802/001.status_value: 3.5 Community participation  in particular the participation of parents is encouraged and supported. Parent involvement is central to the National Curriculum Framework for Children Birth to four year old as well as the National Integrated Policy for Early Childhood Development.
3930/A0/04/802/001.indicator_name: "c2c. Early learning policy and early learning programme ensuring parents' and communities' involvement - score (1-4)  see guidance"
3930/A0/04/802/001.headline: Strong political commitment and momentum as major capacity-building rolled out.

3930/A0/04/802/001.status_value: National Integrated Early Childhood Development Policy was approved by the Cabinet in December 2015. The policy covers vulnerable children  including children with disabilities and other marginalized children. White Paper on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities includes ECD links to the mentioned policy
3930/A0/04/802/001.indicator_name: Existence of policies on inclusive ECD covering particularly children with disabilities and other marginalized children
3930/A0/04/802/001.headline: Strong political commitment and momentum as major capacity-building rolled out.

3930/A0/04/802/001.status_value: 3.5 NCF provides the framework for a quality learning programme based on National Early Learning and Development Standards.
3930/A0/04/802/001.indicator_name: "c2a. Early learning policy and early learning programme including quality early learning curriculum and standards - score (1-4)  see guidance"
3930/A0/04/802/001.headline: Strong political commitment and momentum as major capacity-building rolled out.

3930/A0/04/802/001.status_value: 3.  National Integrated Early Childhood Development Policy was approved by the Cabinet in December 2015  includes strong focus on early learning. However  the budget allocation for ECD remains inadequate vis-à-vis needs of children 0-4 (see UNICEF Social Development Budget Brief 2016)  Government is moving forward implementation planning and costing.
3930/A0/04/802/001.indicator_name: "c2d. Existence of an effective early learning policy with clear budget allocation in place - score (1-4)  see guidance"
